conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height/thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, and the view is clearly angled with the roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall massing and interior volume; clean cutaway and consistent isometric-like view. Minor simplification around some wall ends/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (dining left, kitchen top, living right, bedroom bottom-left, wash/toilet core, stair zone right). Some proportional/partition differences are visible (wet-area/entry partitions and a few wall lengths appear slightly adjusted).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: dining set, kitchen counters/appliances, living seating/table, bed, and bathroom fixtures. Placement generally matches intended rooms; scale/orientation is mostly reasonable.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear and legible with consistent materials. Interior is visible; lighting is adequate. Some openings/windows are not crisply represented, reducing structural readability.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows/openings are simplified; several are not clearly shown or not verifiable on the exact walls compared to the 2D plan.
Minor-to-moderate layout/proportion drift in internal partitions (notably around the wash/toilet/entry core and a few wall segment lengths) versus the 2D plan.

summary: A clear, true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with some proportional/partition drift and simplified or ambiguous door/window placements.
